bug.author: klti
bug.summary: Problem with vector attribute after calling Retokenizer.split
bug.description:
When trying to use split and retokenize like in the docs (<denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/usage/linguistic-features/#retokenization>https://spacy.io/usage/linguistic-features/#retokenization</denchmark-link> ), breaks with an error <denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
code to reproduce (nearly the same as example in docs, only made strings unicode and added displacy.render calls) <denchmark-code>import spacy from spacy import displacy
nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_sm") doc = nlp(u"I live in NewYork right now") print("Before:", [token.text for token in doc]) displacy.render(doc) # works displacy.render(doc, style="dep") # works displacy.render(list(doc.sents), style="dep") # works
with doc.retokenize() as retokenizer: heads = [(doc[3], 1), doc[2]] attrs = {"POS": ["PROPN", "PROPN"], "DEP": ["pobj", "compound"]} retokenizer.split(doc[3], [u"New", u"York"], heads=heads, attrs=attrs) print("After:", [token.text for token in doc]) displacy.render(doc) # works displacy.render(doc, style="dep") # works displacy.render(list(doc.sents), style="dep") # breaks </denchmark-code>
Output <denchmark-code>('Before:', [u'I', u'live', u'in', u'NewYork', u'right', u'now']) ('After:', [u'I', u'live', u'in', u'New', u'York', u'right', u'now']) Traceback (most recent call last): File "test_example.py", line 18, in <module> displacy.render(list(doc.sents), style="dep") # breaks File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/spacy/displacy/__init__.py", line 46, in render docs = [obj if not isinstance(obj, Span) else obj.as_doc() for obj in docs] File "span.pyx", line 224, in spacy.tokens.span.Span.as_doc File "span.pyx", line 410, in spacy.tokens.span.Span.vector.__get__ File "span.pyx", line 187, in __iter__ File "token.pyx", line 392, in spacy.tokens.token.Token.vector.__get__ IndexError: index 6 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 6 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Python version: 2.7.16 Platform: Linux-5.0.3-arch1-1-ARCH-x86_64-with-glibc2.2.5 spaCy version: 2.1.3
P.S.: great library, I love it üëç

comments.comment: Thanks for the report ‚Äì based on the error, this looks like it might be a problem with how the vector attribute is handled after splitting.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/klti>@klti</denchmark-link> : thanks for the report! It was indeed an issue with the attribute as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ines>@ines</denchmark-link> pointed out. This should hopefully be fixed by PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/4097>#4097</denchmark-link> .
